intro: Heracleum sphondylium subsp. orsinii, commonly known as the lesser cow parsley, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a biennial or short-lived perennial herb that typically grows in moist, calcareous soils. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It produces a tall, hollow stem that can reach up to 1.5 meters in height. This subspecies is native to Europe and is often found in wet meadows, riverbanks, and other damp habitats.
